name: Accurate Shot
description: You have learned to sacrifice damage for accuracy when using a ranged weapon.
When making a ranged attack you can take a +5 to hit but your attack deals half damage. You can only take this bonus once per round. This ability cannot be used at the same time as Deadly Shot.

name: Accurate Strike
description: You can use the attack action to make a single accurate attack. You gain advantage on a melee attack and gain a +2 bonus to hit.

name: Alchemist
description: You have learned to brew various chemicals and mixtures. You count as trained for tests to make or identify concoctions.

name: Apprentice Mage
prerequisite: Intelligence 14, not a mage, not a dwarf. You cannot take this feat with Divine Secrets.
description: You have had a little training in the magical arts, gaining a basic understanding of a magical secret.
You learn one secret from the mage basic secret list. Every 2 levels you gain after selecting this feat you can deepen your knowledge of this secret.

This feat can be selected twice but can only be selected for the second time at level 5. When you select it for the second time you may select an advanced mage secret and you can deepen a secret you know every level you gain instead of every second level.
You gain the arcane attack feature of the mage.

name: Bardic Knowledge
description: You can use charisma instead of intelligence when making knowledge tests to learn about anything. You have advantage on gather information and investigation tests to find information. If you fail a knowledge test you almost always know where to find the information you seek, if it is feasible for you to know about it.
You increase your charisma score by 1.

name: Blade Magic
description: Blade magic is an ancient branch of magic, first developed by the elves. It allows the caster to imbue a weapon with magic, making it sharp and accurate.

You can spend 4 points of your casting ability score as a free action to grant a +2 bonus to a bladed weapon you touch. This bonus lasts for an hour. You can only enchant one weapon at a time in this manner. You can regain these spent points in the same way as ability score points spent on spells.

name: Blade Magic II
description: You have learned to improve your blade magic, able to enchant it to overcome the resistances of certain monsters.
When you grant a bonus to a weapon with your blade magic you can also have the weapon count as holy, silvered or steel for the purpose of damaging monsters. In addition, the bonus increases to a +3.

name: Brutal Critical
description: You have learned to take advantage of your most damaging hits.
You deal an extra two dice of damage on a critical hit with a weapon.

name: Cats Grace
description: Through training or foolishness, you have mastered the art of falling off high places.
You gain a +1 bonus to dexterity. You ignore the first 20 ft you fall and have advantage on saves or tests to land safely.

name: Cast on the Move
description: When you take the cast a spell action you can move up to your movement speed instead of 5 ft.

name: Combat Healer
description: You have mastered the art of healing during the chaos of combat.

You can use your main action to move up to double your move speed to a creature that is unconscious from being wounded. You can immediately roll a medicine test and attempt to heal a wound of your choice. If successful, that wound does not count against their wound limit and the wounded creature gains a +5 bonus to Resistance Saves to heal that wound in the future.
A creature can only benefit from this ability once per long rest. The +5 bonus counts towards your limit of wounds you can be providing long term healing to.

name: Combined Crafter
description:
You can combine your crafting abilities to make more advanced items. For example: 
 Blacksmith + arcane crafter = magical weapons. 
    Tinkerer + glyphs = Magic creations 
 Blacksmith + Tinkerer = Trick Weapons 
 You learn an additional crafting trait.

name: Companion
description: Through a close bond with nature, or arcane tinkering you have learned to summon a small animal companion to accompany you.
You summon a small creature to act as a companion. If you select this feat at level 1 you start with the companion, elsewise you must spend a day and 250 silver worth of materials to summon it.
You can see through its eyes and deliver touch spells through it. You can summon your choice of small animal, for example, cat, raven, fish, owl.

If your animal companion is within 300 ft. of you, you can see through its eyes as a free action, becoming blind yourself. Any creature that the animal is touching counts as you touching it for the purposes of casting touch spells.
If your animal companion dies you take 5d6 sanity damage and must purchase materials worth 50 silver and spend a day resummoning it.
Your companion acts on your turn. It can move, take cover or dodge. Your companion cannot attack.

name: Concentration Focus
description: You have learned to keep focused and maintain your concentration on spells.
You have advantage on concentration tests. You do not need to make concentration tests when you take a minor wound or when you are hit but not wounded.

name: Cover Expert
description: You are well practiced at utilising cover to great advantage.
When you take cover, you may use your bonus action to make one ranged attack. You gain an additional +1 armour class while in cover.

name: Daemon Specialist
description: You have mastered the art of hunting and killing daemons.
You have advantage on knowledge tests about daemons and deal additional damage equal to your intelligence modifier to daemons.

name: Dagger Expert
description: You have learned to throw your enemies off guard with a well-placed dagger throw.
Once per turn when you hit a target with a dagger you can give yourself advantage on the next attack against that target. You make an extra attack with a dagger when you Full Attack.

name: Deadly Shot
description: Your arrows strike with greater power at the cost of accuracy.
When making a ranged attack you can take a -3 to hit in exchange for an extra 2d8 damage. You can only take this damage once per round. Cannot be used at the same time as Accurate Shot.

name: Druidic Knowledge
description: You learn druidic and one secret from the druid secret list.
Whenever you gain a level you may learn another secret from this list instead of your normal secret list.
If you are a mage you can elect to change your casting ability to wisdom. Once you make this decision you cannot change it back.

name: Druidic Weapons
description: You learn forgotten druidic weapon techniques.
When using a quarterstaff, sickle, or club you can use wisdom for attack and damage rolls with that weapon.
You gain +1 wisdom

name: Disguise Magic
description: You can disguise an invocation with a channel and verbal components (or more, at the GMs digression) as merely a song or music. You must succeed a performance test against any suspicious party’s insight to succeed at this action. You have advantage on performance tests.

name: Expert Climber
description: You are a well-practiced climber.
While climbing you have advantage on check to not fall or to catch another character that is falling.
You gain +1 strength. You gain a +5 bonus on climb tests to climb quickly and cannot critically fail a climb test.

name: Expert Liar
description: You are skilled at lying and deceiving others, leaving them often unaware that you are lying.
Creatures trying to discern if you are lying have disadvantage on the roll.
You gain +1 charisma.

name: Expert Mage Slayer
description: Your skills at slaying magic users has allowed you to learn how to pierce the magical defences of mages and the like.
You deal an extra 2d6 damage against spellcasters. You ignore any bonuses to defence or armour class from any spells when attacking a spellcaster.

name: Extra Attack
description: You have learned how to attack quickly.
You gain an additional attack

name: Extra Attack II
description: You have learned to attack even faster!
You gain another additional attack.

name: Extra Resilient
description: You train to increase your resistance to certain effects.
Your last minor save becomes a major save. Once per short rest you can give yourself advantage on a save.

name: Extra Wound
description: Your body is tough and hardened, able to take more punishment than usual.
Your wound limit is increased by 1.
Special: This feat can be taken a number of times; each time has more prerequisites.
1: None
2: Rogue, Warrior, Priest
3: Warrior, Priest, Level 3
4: Rage OR Warrior level 7

name: Fae Mind
description: Your mind shifts a little, becoming more faelike.
You have advantage on saves against enthral and fascination.

Once per downtime as a reaction, you can separate your mind from your brain. For the next hour you ignore psychic and sanity damage, ignore any madness or confusion effects, and become immune to enthral and fascination.

name: Fae Specialist
description: You have mastered the art of hunting and killing fae.
You have advantage on knowledge tests about fae and deal additional damage equal to your intelligence modifier to fae.

name: Finesse
description: Your skill with lighter weapons allows you to rely on speed and dexterity rather than brute strength when using these weapons.
You can use dexterity to hit and damage instead of strength when using a light melee weapon.

name: Forceful Personality
description: Your mind is your greatest weapon when interacting with people.
When rolling a diplomacy or intimidation test you can add either your intelligence or wisdom modifier to the roll.
You gain +1 to wisdom, charisma, or intelligence

name: Glyph
description: You have learned the basics of glyphs.
You learn one minor or major glyph.

name: Hard Hearted
prerequisite: Intelligence or wisdom 12, Trait: Cruel Upbringing or Flaw: Bloodthirsty
description: You do not react as much to death, gore, and other horrors as normal people.
You gain sanity damage reduction 2. This reduces all sanity damage received by 2.
You no longer lose sanity when seeing allies die or go unconscious, or from killing innocent people.

name: Hard to Kill
description: Your body clings to life more easily than others.
You only instantly die if you take more than 40 damage after your defence, rather than 30. You have advantage on any saves to avoid an instant death effect or to stop bleeding out.

name: Improved Recovery
description: You recover your defence quickly, able to get back into the fight rapidly.
Your recovery dice become d8s.

name: In Touch with Nature
description: You are in tune with nature.

You can communicate with animals on a basic level. You can also attempt to tame wild animals. You have advantage on skill tests to interact socially with animals and may use wisdom in place of charisma for these tests.

name: Inspiring Leadership
description: You can inspire your allies with your words or actions.

On your turn, as a bonus action you can select an ally within 30 ft. They gain a d6 they can add to any one attack roll, save or test within the next minute. You can do this a number of times equal to your charisma modifier per short rest.

name: Knowledgeable
description: You have a wide array of knowledge from many sources.
You are trained in 2 additional knowledge skills. You have advantage on any knowledge skill you are trained in. You gain a bonus to all knowledge skills equal to half your level.

name: Mage Hunter
description: You are adept at hunting spellcasters.

If a creature within 5 ft tries to cast a spell you can immediately make an attack against them. If your attack hits they must immediately make a concentration test, either against your damage or against your DC, whichever is higher. If they fail, the spell fails.
You have advantage on spellcraft tests to identify spells.

name: Medium Armour
description: You have learned to use more armours and lighter shields.
You can use medium armour and steel shields. You gain +1 strength.

name: Monster Specialist
description: You have mastered the art of hunting and killing monsters.
You have advantage on knowledge tests about monsters and deal additional damage equal to your intelligence modifier to monsters.

name: Multi-Disciplined
description: You branch out in your knowledge, learning skills or abilities that you normally would not learn.
You next time you select a feat you can ignore the class prerequisite for that, and only that, feat.
You also gain a + 1 bonus to an ability score of your choice. You cannot ignore a class prerequisite for a class that your species can not be. You can take this feat any number of times.
There are a number of feats that you cannot take with this feat. Double check with your GM before you select this feat.

name: Musical Secrets
description: You learn the secret of music. You can use a musical instrument as a channel for your invocations.
If you are a rogue, you deepen your knowledge of the secret of music every 2nd level.

name: Heavy Armour
description: You learn to use all armours and shields.
You can use heavy armour and tower shields. You gain +1 strength.

name: Poisoner
description: You have learned to gather and make poisons. You count as trained when using or identifying poisons.

name: Precise Strike
description: Your strikes take advantage of any weakness and lapse in your targets guard.

When using a light melee weapon, you deal an extra 1d6 damage. You must have advantage on the attack or an enemy of the target aside from yourself within 5 feet of the target to gain this additional damage.
You can always apply precise strike to a critical hit. You can only deal this extra damage once per turn.
When you reach level 5 this damage increases by 1d6 and another 1d6 at level 9.
If you are a rogue, you can make precise strikes when you use a ranged weapon or a thrown weapon, providing you fulfil the normal conditions to make a precise strike.

name: Protector
description: You defend your allies with your trusty shield, not just yourself.

While wearing a shield you can grant your bonus to AC and DR from your shield to an ally adjacent to you when they are attacked. You lose the bonus AC and DR you would normally gain from your shield until the end of your next turn.
All shields provide an additional + 1 armour class.

name: Push On
description: Your words bolster your allies to greater heights.
Once per downtime you can invigorate your allies with a 10-minute speech. Chose up to 10 creatures you can see.

Each creature regains 2d6 defence. In addition, each creature increases their wound limit by one (for determining unconsciousness only), can ignore one level of exhaustion and gains +2 on attack rolls and save DCs for the next 2 hours. A creature can only gain this benefit once per downtime.

You can use this ability as a main action, but the benefits are decreased. You can only choose 6 targets, each regains 1d6 defence, gains +1 to attack rolls, and ignores one level of exhaustion for an hour.

name: Quick Draw
description: You can draw as many weapons as you have attacks during your turn. You gain a +3 bonus to initiative.

name: Rapid Reload
description: You are well practised with loading weapons, allowing you to fire them more quickly than most people.
You can make up to two attacks per round with weapons with the loading properly, rather than one. You must have an ability that grants you the extra attack.
Once you reach level 7 your limit for loading weapons is increased to 3.

name: Rapid Response
description: You are always alert and ready for danger, ready to react in an instant.
You have advantage on initiative tests.
You can use your full defence if surprised.

name: Reliable Medic
description: Your medical help is always a little useful for those you try to help.
Any creature you attempt to heal that has a major or minor wound always gets at least a +3 bonus on its Resistance Save to heal the wound.

name: Resilient
description: Your minor save becomes a major save and you gain your final untrained save as a minor save.

name: Runner
description: You can run quickly.

You gain a +1 bonus to dexterity. When you take the run action you can move 4 times your movement speed instead of 3 times. When you take the withdraw action you can move 3 times your movement speed instead of 2 times.

name: Sane
description: Your mind is well guarded against madness.
You gain an additional 2 sanity every odd level, including the level when you gain this feat.

name: Second Wind
description: You can regain your defence in the middle of combat, allowing you to continue fighting in tough situations.
Once per short rest you can spend a recovery dice to regain 1d8+con defence on your turn as a bonus action. You can only use this ability in combat or immediately after.

name: Sharpshooter
description: You have learned to attack at great range, striking your enemies long before they reach you.
Double your range with any ranged attacks.

name: Silent Invocation
description: You have learned to cast invocations without speaking, allowing you to cast them while gagged or similarly disposed.
You can cast invocations without speaking.

name: Skilled
description: You widen your pool of abilities, gaining new skills.
You are trained in three additional skills.

name: SMASH
description: You smash good. Break things good.
When rolling a smash test, you can reroll any 1s or 2s. You always have advantage on any strength test.

name: Speedy
description: You always move quickly, in combat and out.
Your movement speed is increased by 10 ft. You gain a + 2 bonus to armour class against attacks of opportunity.

name: Stolen Secrets
prerequisite: Intelligence 18 or Charisma 18, at least one secret known, Level 5, and Bardic Knowledge.
description: When you would learn a new secret or deepen your knowledge of a secret you can instead steal an invocation from another secret, even one you are not allowed to know. You cannot steal an invocation from a mastery higher than your highest level mastery or an invocation from an eldritch secret and if you steal an invocation from a final mastery it counts as you mastering a secret for the purposes of the maximum number of secrets you can master.

name: Tough
description: You are able to avoid and absorb damage with great skill.
You gain an extra 4 defence and gain DR 1.

name: Tougher
description: You are able to avoid and absorb damage with great skill.
You gain an extra 6 defence.

name: Uncanny Reflexes
description: You always seems to know where your enemies will strike, allowing you to avoid the worst of their attacks.
While not wearing armour and not using a shield you can add either your intelligence modifier or wisdom modifier to your AC and Avoidance Saves.

name: Undead Specialist
description: You have mastered the art of hunting and killing undead.

You have advantage on knowledge tests about monsters and may use wisdom instead of intelligence for these tests. You also deal additional damage equal to your intelligence or wisdom modifier to monsters.

name: Vicious
description: You take pleasure in killing people, more so if they do not deserve it.
You do not take any sanity damage from killing an innocent, in fact you regain 1 sanity each time you do so.

name: Weapon Master
description: You have focused your training on one specific weapon, granting you a special mastery of the weapon.
When you select this feat you choose this weapon, you get +2 on rolls to hit with this weapon.
Depending on the weapon you selected, you learn a special technique with that weapon. You can use this special technique once per turn, unless the ability says otherwise.
This technique drains your attack ability score, much like a caster drains their casting ability score when casting spells.
Special and trick weapons may have special weapon master techniques.
You can take this feat multiple times, selecting a different weapon each time.
See feats section for chart on abilities

name: Wardancer
description: You have learned to move with great agility in battle.

Once per short rest you can begin to dance, sing, or play an instrument in battle as a bonus action. An attack of opportunity cannot target you while this lasts. In addition, you and your allies regain 1 defence at the start of their turn. This ability lasts for 1 minute.

name: Bull Rush
description: Your charges are devastating, knocking your opponents onto the ground.
When you hit a target while charging and using a strength weapon, the target must succeed on an Avoidance Save or be knocked prone. You deal an additional 1d6 damage on a charge.

name: Bow Expert
description: Your mastery of bows allows you to fire rapidly.
When attacking with a bow you can take an extra attack every turn.

name: Charger
description: You learn to use the momentum of charging to your advantage, cutting through your enemy's defence.
You have advantage on attacks when you charge.

name: Chosen Weapon
description: Your mastery of your chosen weapon allows you to take your skill with it to new heights.
You select a weapon which you have weapon master for. You may add your full level, instead of half, to attacks with this weapon.

name: Cleave
description: Your strikes are so powerful that they can go clean through your enemies to hit multiple foes at once.

When you wound an enemy, you can immediately make another attack against a target within 5 feet of your original target. This extra attack is not restricted by normal limits on the number of attacks in a turn or a round. When using a ranged weapon, the target of your cleave attack must be directly in the line of fire from your weapon to be targeted by the second attack. You can cleave with thrown weapons in the same was as ranged weapons.
You can only make a single additional attack from this feat in a turn.

name: Crippling Wound
description: Your strikes cripple and slow your enemies.

Whenever you wound a target, you can force them to make a Resistance Save or have their movement speed reduced by half for the next minute, providing they have physiology that would allow this slowing. A creature can only have their movement speed reduced once by this ability.
A creature slowed by this effect takes an additional 2d6 damage whenever they are hit.

name: Defender
description: You are a stalwart bastion on the battlefield, tough and able to protect your allies.

You gain +3 defence. When an enemy goes to attack another creature while they are within your reach, you can immediately make a melee attack against the creature making the attack. This attack does not count towards the total number of actions you can take outside of your turn but can only be made once per round.
If your attack hits, your target has disadvantage on the triggering attack.

name: Endless Rage
description: Your rage is unending and violent.
Your rages last for 10 minutes.
If you have no rages left, you can rage whenever you have been the target of a spell or attack in the previous round.
Whenever you are not raging your melee weapon attacks using strength deal an additional 2 damage.

name: Expert Defender
description: You gain another 3 defence. When an enemy attacks another creature while adjacent to you, you can interpose yourself between the attacker and the target. The attacker instead attacks you, and you can immediately make a melee attack against the attacker, giving them disadvantage on the triggering attack as normal. You can use this attack in addition to the attack from defender, but not both against the same creature.

name: Firearm Expert
description: You are trained in the use of firearms and are able to make use of their devastating power.
You gain +2 to hit with firearms. Critical hits with firearms deal an extra dice of damage.

name: Harry the Wounded
description: Your attacks are more effective at creatures that are already wounded.
Once per turn when you hit a wounded target with an attack you can deal an extra 2d10 damage.

name: Improved Cleave
description: Your cleaves become even more powerful, able to strike up to three enemies with a single blow.
When you cleave you can make a third attack against a third target if you also wound the second target. You can also make up to two additional attacks from cleave in a single turn.

name: Improved Rage
description: Your rage becomes less taxing and more effective
You can rage an extra time per long rest. While raging your extra damage on each hit increases to 5.

name: Mindless Rage
description: While raging you are immune to psychic and sanity damage, fascination, enthral and mind reading. You have advantage on any mind affecting effects.

name: Monkey Grip
description: Your immense strength allows you to use large weapons in one hand.
You can use a two-handed melee weapon one handed. Unwieldy weapons require strength 24 to use in one hand without disadvantage.

name: Mounted Charger
description: You and your horse move as one when performing a charge, allowing you to devastate the target of your charge.
While mounted you may move up to double your horses speed when charging. If you move up to your horse’s base speed before your first attack it deals an additional 3d10 damage.

name: Mounted Expert
description: When you charge while riding you can channel the momentum of your mount in order to strike twice.
While mounted you may take an extra attack while charging as long as you have at least two attacks.

name: Rage
description: During battle you enter a mindless rage, ignoring damage and striking with great ferocity.
Twice per long rest you can rage as a bonus action for a minute. You deal an additional 3 damage on melee attacks using strength and your wound limit is increased by 1. You also gain DR 2.
While raging you cannot cast magic and you have disadvantage on any tests or saves using intelligence, wisdom, or charisma.

name: Sniper
description: While standing still you gain great accuracy with ranged weapons.
If you do not move during your turn you gain a +3 bonus to hit on the first ranged weapon attack you make on your turn, and a +2 bonus to hit on any subsequent ranged weapon attack.

name: Spear Master
description: You have learned to set your weapon against a charge.
When using a reach weapon, you can make an attack when an enemy enters your reach once per round. You do not have -2 to hit when attacking a target inside your reach.

name: Stay with Me
description: You have learned to prevent your opponent from running away from you while locked in combat.
If you hit a creature with an attack of opportunity or another attack outside your turn you reduce its speed to 0.

name: Stunning Blow
description: Your strikes can muddy your opponents’ thoughts, leaving them vulnerable and unable to retaliate.
You can attempt to stun a creature you hit with an attack. They must succeed on a Resistance Save or be stunned until the end of their next round.
You can use this ability a number of times equal to half your strength modifier, minimum 1, per short rest.

name: Take the Hit
description: You have trained your body to ignore damage, becoming able to shrug off deadly blows.

Once per short rest, when you are hit with an attack or spell you can take 25 less damage from the triggering attack and only take half damage from any remaining damage. On your next turn after using this ability you are stunned until the end of your turn.
If the triggering attack or spell directly causes wounds, you instead either take less wounds or reduce wound severity (GM discretion).

name: Two Weapon Beast
description: You can dual wield any melee weapons that you can hold in one hand.

name: Two Weapon Extra Attack
description: When dual wielding you can make an attack with your off-hand weapon whenever you attack with your main weapon during your turn.

name: Two Weapon Fighter
description: Your skill with weapons allows you to use two weapons at once to great effect, dealing more damage and avoiding some blows.
When dual wielding you can add your ability score modifier to damage rolls made with your off hand weapon. You gain +1 to armour class against melee attackers while using two melee weapons.

name: Two Weapon Master
description: You may dual wield any non-heavy weapons.

name: Vow of Asceticism
description: You give up on worldly possessions to gain almost supernatural combat prowess.
Attacking with an unarmed attack counts as a light melee weapon that deals 1d6 damage. You also gain a bonus to AC and DR equal to half your level.
You can make two unarmed attacks per round, as if you were dual wielding light weapons.
You cannot own any items aside from a quarterstaff, two sets of basic clothes, a waterskin, a sack for food and plain food.

You must give away all your current possessions to the poor or to a charity, not your party, unless doing so would endanger the world/the person you are giving the items to. You cannot keep any treasure you find, though you still must take a share of any loot your party finds to give to the poor and needy (not your party).
At level 4 your unarmed attacks and quarterstaff deal 1d8 damage, gain a +1 to hit and damage and count as silvered and steel for the purpose of overcoming damage resistance.
At level 8 your unarmed and quarterstaff attacks deal 1d10 damage and the damage from them cannot be reduced or resisted. You gain a +3 to hit and damage when using a quarterstaff or unarmed attack.

name: Aura
description: You can create an aura around yourself that bolsters your allies' defences.

You can use your main action to and spend 3 points of wisdom to make an aura that lasts until the end of your next long rest. This aura grants all creatures of your choice within 15 feet of you a +2 bonus on all saves.

name: Aura of Protection
description: Your aura improves, defending your allies against physical damage.
Any creature of your choice within your aura gains damage resistance 2.

name: Aura of Courage
description: Your aura protects your allies against fear and other mental effects.
Any creature of your choice within your aura gains resistance to sanity and psychic damage and cannot be frightened.

name: Improved Aura
description: Your aura covers even more ground and provides more protection.
The range of your aura increases to 30 ft. You can also choose to spend additional wisdom when you create your aura. Each point you spend increases the range by 5ft.
Any creature in your aura gains a +1 bonus to armour class.

name: Divine Faith
description: Your belief grants you protection against the horrors of the world, as well as a healing touch to save others from terrible fates.
You have advantage on Mental Saves. You can use a bonus action and spend 2 points of wisdom to cure a creature you touch of one of the following conditions. Stunned, Paralysed, Poisoned.
These spent points can be regained in the same way as points spent on casting spells.

name: Divine Guidance
description: When given a binary decision you can spend an hour praying to your god for guidance. You gain some insight into the best course of action from your god. For the next hour you have +2 on attack rolls and saves as you revel in the guidance of your god.
You cannot use this ability until you complete a long rest.
You gain +1 wisdom.

name: Divine Secrets
prerequisite: Prerequisite: Priest, this secret cannot be learned with the multi-disciplined feat. You cannot take this feat if you take Apprentice Mage.
description: Your faith grants you access to magical secrets like those of the mage.
When you select this feat, you can learn two secrets from the following list: Life, Fire, Water, Ice, Plants, Stone, Light, Storm, Death, Daemon Protection.
Every time you gain a level, you may learn one additional secret from the above list, or you can deepen your knowledge of a secret you already know.
When casting spells, your casting ability score is wisdom.
You gain the arcane attack feature of the mage.

name: Faith Healer
description: Once per long rest you can call upon your god to aid you while attempting to heal a creature. You gain +5 on one medicine test and the creature you are attempting to heal gains a +2 bonus to Resistance Saves to heal any wounds during their next long rest.

name: Flaming Weapons
description: Your weapons burn with the power of your faith.

Once per short rest you can use a bonus action and spend 2 points of wisdom to light all melee weapons you are holding on fire with the power of your god. For ten minutes any attack you make with those weapons deals an extra 1d10 fire damage. You can use this ability as part of an attack.
The spent wisdom can be regained the same was as points spent on casting spells.

name: Martial Clergy
prerequisite: Priest, cannot be gained with multi-disciplined
description: Your clerical training has given you martial skills beyond that of normal priests.
You can add half your level (minimum 1) to your weapon attack rolls.

name: Saint
description: You learn the powers of the saints, gaining a powerful magical ceremony.
Select one ceremony that is marked as a saintly ceremony. You learn this ceremony. You can take this feat twice.

name: Secrets of the Gods
description: You gain divine inspiration about one of your secrets, burning its mysteries into your mind.

One secret you have learned through divine secrets becomes your primary secret. The first invocation you cast from this secret after a downtime is free. Whenever you cast an invocation from this secret its cost is halved.

name: Smite
description: You channel divine light through your weapons, smiting the foes of your god.

When you hit a creature with a melee weapon you can spend 1 point of wisdom to deal an extra d8 radiant damage to your target. If the target is daemonic or undead in nature you instead deal an extra 2d8 radiant damage. You can spend up to 8 additional points of wisdom to deal 1d8 radiant extra damage per 2 points spent.

A smite can be used to damage a creature that you would not normally be able to harm. If your attack roll would have hit a creature that is incorporeal or has some similar ability to avoid damage from certain effects (GM digression), you can still spend wisdom points in order to deal the extra damage, but not your weapon damage.
The spent wisdom can be regained the same was as points spent on casting spells

name: Saint of Gunpowder
description: Your devotion rings with the sound of gunfire and the smell of powder.

When you hit an enemy with a ranged attack with a firearm you can spend 1 point of wisdom to deal an extra d6 damage to your target. If the target is daemonic or undead in nature you instead deal an extra 2d6 damage. You can spend up to 8 additional points of wisdom to dead 1d6 extra damage per 2 points spent.
The spent wisdom can be regained the same was as points spent on casting spells

name: Saint of Innovation
prerequisite: Priest, Divine Secrets,Must be taken at Level 1
description: You follow a god of innovation or knowledge. Your casting ability score is changed to intelligence. You may select the secret of steel, secret of golems, or the secret of glyphs as one of your secrets from divine secrets and all three secrets are added to your list of secrets you can select when levelling up.
You gain a bonus equal to half your level to either crafting tests or knowledge tests, chosen when you select this feat.

name: Arcane Recovery
description: You have learned to quickly recover your mental strength in order to keep casting magic.
You can use your main action to spend a recovery dice and regain 1d8+2 intelligence. Once you use this ability you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

name: Arcane Archer
description: You can spend 2 points of intelligence to grant yourself a +1 bonus on attack rolls with bows or crossbows for a minute. While you have this bonus you can spend two points of intelligence to deal an extra 2d8 damage of a type granted by your known secrets.
The spent intelligence can be regained the same way as points spent on casting spells.

name: Arcane Ward
description: You can create a wall of magic to defend yourself against an attack.

When you are hit by an attack you can spend 2 points of intelligence to grant yourself an additional 10 defence against that attack and any other attack until the end of your next turn. Once your use this ability you cannot use it until you complete a short rest.
The spent intelligence can be regained the same was as points spent on casting spells.

name: Blood Magic
description: You learn the basics of blood magic, a secret form of magic that draws upon the strength of blood to empower spells.

*Blood Points* 
When you cause a wound on a creature that can bleed or cause a creature to bleed through a spell such as gather the blood, you gain a blood point. You can spend blood points instead of defence (1 blood point for 1 defence) to reduce invocation cost. You can have a maximum number of blood points equal to your intelligence score.
Damage you deal to yourself cannot be reduced or ignored. Damage dealt to yourself cannot be done to a ward or any other source of defence aside from your own natural defence.

name: Advanced Blood Magic
description: Your mastery of blood improves.

When casting an invocation, you can decrease its cost by 2 or 3, taking 2d6-2 or 3d6-3 damage respectively. When casting an invocation from the secret of blood you can deal an additional 3d8 damage to your target by dealing 2d6 damage to yourself.
Any invocations from the secret of blood have their cost reduced by twice the normal amount when using your own blood. This reduction ignores the normal limits for minimum spell costs.
Damage you deal to yourself cannot be reduced or ignored.

name: Create Trinket
description: You can create minor magical items. You count as trained when making or identifying such items.

name: Daemon Blood Tattoo
description: You learn to harvest the blood of daemons or monsters to create powerful magical tattoos.
Many creatures have powerful blood that can be used. The GM has the details, go bother them about it.

name: Devastating Magic
description: Your magic deals an extra punch, causing more, and more serious wounds.

Whenever you cast an invocation that deals damage you roll an extra 2 damage dice and can reroll any 1s or 2s on the dice. Whenever a creature takes a wound from your spells those wounds cannot be healed without magic.

name: Eldritch Secrets
prerequisite: Mage, cannot be an elf, Level 5
description: There is some magic that is not meant to be learned by mortal minds.
You learn an eldritch secret. When you level up you may choose this secret to deepen your knowledge. This Feat can be picked multiple times, teaching a different eldritch secret each time.
Note: This feat might require a source of knowledge like an ancient carving or forgotten tome. Speak with your GM before taking this feat.

name: Elemental Focus
prerequisite: Mage, must be taken at level 1
description: Your path to magic is an unusual one. Instead of learning from books or scrolls you attune with the elements and use your body to cast spells.

You only begin with two mage secrets. You do not deepen one secret at level 1. You can only learn from the following secrets. Fire, Water, Air, Stone, Light or Ice. This restriction applied to all secrets learned or already learned.

You can use dexterity or strength instead of intelligence when calculating DC and spell attack rolls. You must select which when you make your character and you cannot change this later. You gain an additional 2 defence.

name: Empowered Casting
description: Pick two secrets you have learned. Whenever you cast an invocation from either of those secrets all dice involved in that invocation explode.

name: Golemancy
description: You learn the secret of golems.

name: Gun Mage
description: You can add a bonus equal to half your level to attack rolls when using firearms. When you hit a creature with a firearm attack you can spend twice the usual cost of a spell to cast the spell at the target. The spell must have a range of at least half of the distance between you and the target. Once you use this ability you cannot cast spells for 2 rounds, including through a firearm.

name: Hex
description: You can use 2 witchery points and your main action to hex a target, gaining various benefits. While hexed, the target has disadvantage on saves against your spells.

When you select this feat, you may choose one of the following options for your hex. Every second level you gain after taking this feat you can select another option. You can only have one target hexed at a time. A hex lasts for a number of hours equal to your level. At level 9 your hex lasts for a day.
- Tracking Hex. You know the rough location and direction of the target.
- Baleful Hex. Whenever the target takes damage, they take an additional 1d8 damage.

- Burning Hex. The target feels like it is on fire. They take 1d6 psychic damage every minute they are hexed and within your line of sight. The target always knows which direction you are in while this hex is active.
- Suggestive Hex. All charisma checks against the target have advantage.

name: Secret Mastery
prerequisite: Mage, Maximum mastery of a secret.
description: Your focus on one secret has made the spells of that secret easier to cast.

Select a secret you have completely mastered. All invocations in that secret have their costs reduced by 2 or halved, whichever is better. Whenever you cast a spell from this secret you can spend an additional 2 points to give yourself advantage on an attack roll or the target disadvantage on a save against the spell.

name: Secrets of Summoning
prerequisite: Mage, Level 5, At least one secret deepened twice.
description: You learn to summon a creature, based on your secrets. You learn the summon creature ceremony.

name: Primal Magic
prerequisite: Mage, must be taken at level 1
description: Your magic is wilder and more primal than most mages.
You can choose to change your casting ability score to wisdom. Once changed you cannot change it back.

You cannot take any of the following secrets or any spells from the following secrets: Daemon Protection, Protection, Antimagic, Arcane. This includes secrets selected at level 1 or secrets or spells learned through other feats or any other abilities.
Whenever you cast an invocation that deals damage it deals an extra d8 damage of a random damage type.
Whenever you cast an invocation you must roll a d12. If the number rolled is lower than the cost or a 1, then you overload the invocation, causing the cost to double and any effects to double.
The invocation also releases a powerful burst of magic. Roll on the following table. If you roll the same number twice apply the rolled effect and then roll again.

name: Witchery
description: You can learn the secret of witchcraft. You cannot deepen your knowledge of any secret besides the secret of witchcraft after level 1. This limitation does not apply to a secret gained through the Eldritch Secret feat.

You gain a number of witchery points equal to your wisdom modifier + your intelligence modifier (not including any reductions from casting spells). You can spend these points instead of your casting ability score when casting an invocation. You regain 1d6 points at the end of a long rest.

name: Witches Mark
description: Chose an invocation you can cast. Its cost is reduced by 2. You gain a visible mark on your face. The mark of witchcraft. Those who recognise this mark will know you are a witch and mistrust you accordingly.
Whenever you level up you can select a new invocation to reduce the cost of by 1. Whenever you do this your constitution is reduced by 1.

name: Actor
description: You are well skilled at impersonation and disguise. You can put together a disguise kit with 3 different disguises for 150 silver.

You can spend a minute preparing your disguise. It can include fake hair, platform shoes, different clothes, hats, etc. While wearing the disguise you have advantage and + 5 on tests to act as the subject of the disguise.

name: Assassin
description: You are at your most deadly when you get the drop on your opponents.
You deal double damage on the first round of combat if you are not surprised.

name: Bleeding Strike
description: Your attacks leave your enemies bleeding.
Whenever you hit with a melee weapon your target must succeed on a Resistance Save or gain bleed equal to the damage dice of your weapon for 1d4 rounds.

name: Careful Shooter
description: Your practice with firearms allows you to negate the worst misfires.
You can reroll the misfire dice when using a firearm. You ignore the bonus to armour class when shooting into a melee combat.

name: Deadly Critical
description: Your critical hits ignore defence.

name: Deadly Grapple
description: When you grapple a target from stealth you can immediately make an attack as a bonus action. This attack can be used to execute.

name: Distracting Strike
description: Your strikes throw your opponent off guard.

When you hit a creature with a melee attack you can move up to your movement speed as a bonus action without provoking attacks of opportunity from that creature. The next attack against that creature has advantage.

name: Evasion
description: You can dodge to avoid the worst of area of effect effects.
When you make an Avoidance Save to avoid damage that would allow you to take half damage on a successful save you instead take no damage on a success and only half damage on a failure.

name: Expert Rogue Talents
description: Your bonus to stealth, unlock locks, or disarm traps from rogue talents increases to be equal to your level.

name: Improved Precise Strike
description: Your precise strike damage increases by 1d6. When you reach level 7 (or if you have already passed it) it increases by another 1d6. When you reach level 10 (or if you are already there) it increases by another 1d6.

name: Jack of All Trades
description: You have a wide variety of skills, not as well trained as others, but good enough for an attempt.
You receive a bonus equal to half your level to all skill tests you are not trained in.

name: Pistol Expert
description: When using pistols you gain +2 to hit. You can reload one pistol for free per turn, even if you do not have a free hand.

name: Roguish Speed
description: You can move more quickly than others.
Your movement speed is increased by 10ft.
When you use the sneak action you can move up to twice your movement speed.

name: Skill Focus
description: You focus on one skill, honing your ability to extraordinary levels.
You gain a bonus to one skill equal to your level. You must be trained in this skill.
You have advantage on skill tests involving this skill.

name: Skill Tricks
description: You have learned to use your skills in combat for increased effectiveness. Each skill trick has a prerequisite skill.
Select 3 tricks from the following list, if you do not have the prerequisite for a skill trick you want you may save this selection until later.

**Acrobatic Tumble** 
*Acrobatics 12* 
You can avoid an AoO by making an acrobatics checks equal to the attack roll of whoever is trying to attack you

**Fast Hands** 
*Sleight of Hand 10* 
You can use a concoction or tinkering item that normally takes a main action to use as a bonus action.

**Wall Run** 
*Climb 12 or Acrobatics 15* 
You can climb directly along a wall or up a sheer surface for one round before falling (if you don’t end somewhere you can climb or stand).

name: Stealth
description: When hidden from your target you ignore half of its defence. If you are already ignoring half its defence, you instead ignore all its defence.

name: Stealth Killer
description: If you kill your target when attacking while hidden you do not reveal your position automatically. You deal extra damage equal to your strength or dexterity when attacking a target who cannot see you.

name: Dwarven Armour Training
description: You gain an additional 2 damage resistance while using heavy armour and a shield.

name: Elven Grace
description: Your otherworldly grace and poise leaves a lasting impact on those you interact with.
You can add your dexterity modifier in the place of charisma when interacting with non-elves. You deal an extra point of damage with any dexterity based attacks.

name: Elvish Magic
description: When casting an invocation, you can spend wisdom to increase the power of the invocation. If the invocation requires a save you can spend wisdom equal to the cost to give the target disadvantage on the save. If the invocation deals damage to a single target you can spend up to 3 points of wisdom to deal an extra 1d8 damage per point spent.
If you are casting with wisdom you can instead spend intelligence.
The cost of increasing the power of an invocation cannot be reduced.
The spent wisdom or intelligence can be regained the same was as points spent on casting spells.

name: Elvish Archery
description: You gain +4 to hit with bows (not crossbows). You cannot use firearms.

name: Draconic Bond
description: You have formed a close bond with the allies of your people, the dragons. You have advantage on charisma checks when interacting with dragons. You deal an extra 2 damage with melee weapons or spells that deal fire or ice damage.
If you gain a dragon companion you gain advantage on any attacks against a foe next to the dragon.

name: Halfling Charm
description: You get along well with the big folk.
You have advantage on charisma skills when interacting with humans, elves, or dwarves. You always count as surprising one of these as long as you are not overtly hostile before starting combat.

name: Halfling Luck
description: Fate often works in your favour, even when the odds are against you.
You can give yourself advantage on an attack roll, test, or save. This advantage cancels out any disadvantage, meaning you always have advantage, no matter the situation.
You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to your charisma modifier.
This ability cannot be used on tests or saves for things that occur over a long time, like crafting, saves against exhaustion or similar effects.

name: Halfling Resilience
description: You gain a bonus equal to your level on Mental Saves. You gain a +1 bonus to wisdom.

name: Human Adaptability
description: You quickly adapt to changing circumstances. You have advantage on any tests for surviving in rough terrain, you have advantage on survival tests to navigate and you have advantage on tests to understand new languages or cultural systems.
You increase an ability score of your choice by 1.

name: Runic Magic
description: You have learned a smattering of runic magic. Pick two mage invocations that make sense as runes. You can spend a turn applying one of these runes to a metal melee weapon, spending intelligence as normal. The next time this weapon hits a target, you cast the invocation, targeting the creature you have hit. If the invocation normally requires a spell attack roll you can instead roll another attack with whatever bonus you just used to make the triggering attack.
You can take this feat multiple times, learning 2 new runes each time
You can have a number of active runes equal to your maximum intelligence modifier. Once placed, a rune lasts for a year and a day, unless it has a set duration or is used.

name: Runic Master
description: Your mastery of magic allows you to create permanent runes that mirror the effects of rituals.

Chose a number of rituals from basic mage secrets equal to your intelligence modifier that effect a single creature. You can create a permanent runestone bound to a creature with that ritual effect by spending a week and 1000 silver. While the creature has the runestone on their possession they are permanently under the effect of the ritual.

name: Dwarven Runic Armour
description: You can put one of your runes onto metal armour or a shield. You gain +2 to armour class until either a creature hits you with a melee attack or the end of your next long rest. If it ends when a creature hits you, you can cast the spell at them as if you had hit them with a runed weapon.

name: Dwarven Anti-magic
description: You learn the Secret of Nullification. Every two levels you gain you deepen your knowledge of this secret.
Intelligence is the casting ability for this secret.
